title: The Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott. (Supplementary volume: containing notes, historical and illustrative, by the author, glossary, etc.)
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Accident added to the damage which attended thishasty movement. In destroying their magazine at StNinians, the Highlanders managed so awkwardly asto blow up at the same time the church itself, bywhich several lives were lost. This was represented,by the malice of party spirit, as having been an intentional act ou the part of the Prince's army ; a thingscarcely to be supposed, since some of themselves,and particularly the man who sired tbe train,* werekilled by the explosion.
